latestVersion.depositorRequirements: To request access to RESTRICTED data files from the Texas Adoption Project, copy the letter located under the Conditions tab below onto a letter or an e-mail with the requested information filled in, and send to the address specified.
latestVersion.conditions:
Distributor Requirements:

To request access to a restricted data file from the Texas Adoption Project, copy this page onto a letter or an e-mail with the requested information filled in, and send to Dr Joseph M. Horn, 407 Rock Springs Court, College Station, TX 77845, or to horn@mail.utexas.edu with cc: to loehlin@psy.utexas.edu.

1. Your name, address, and academic affiliation.
2. The name of the file you wish to access.
3. A brief description of t he use you plan to make of the data.
4. Agreement with the following conditions:
(a). I will use these data for scholarly research only, and not for any personal or commercial purposes.
(b). Any publication or dissemination of the results of my research will only include statistics for groups, not data for individuals or families, whether identified or not. Nor will it include any information from which individuals or families could plausibly be identified.
(c). I will not make or facilitate any attempt to communicate with individuals or families from the study, or to intrude otherwise on their privacy.
(d). If I should happen to become aware of the identity of any individual or family in the study, I will keep this fact confidential, and not pursue it further in any way whatever.
(e). I will not transmit any of the data from the file to third parties; they must themselves satisfy the conditions for obtaining access to the data. (f). Any publication based on these data will not duplicate or infringe upon prior publications from the Texas Adoption Project. (They are listed i n the documentation for each file.)

BY PLACING MY NAME IN THE SPACE LABELED “SIGNATURE” BELOW I CONFIRM THAT

(A) I HAVE READ AND UNDERSTOOD THE CONDITIONS SET FORTH ABOVE, AND AGREE TO BE BOUND BY THEM.
(B) THE INFORMATION I HAVE PROVIDED IS ACCURATE AND I HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO SIGN THE FORM,
(C) I AGREE TO CONFINE MYSELF TO ANALYSIS OF THE DATA, AND NOT TO REPRODUCE IT, IN ANY FORM, WITHOUT PRIOR EXPRESS WRITTEN CONSENT.

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This study presents data from two samples from the Texas Adoption Project. The main sample consists of 300 families who adopted a child from a Texas home for unwed mothers between 1963 and 1971. Included are ability and personality data from the adoptees and other children in the families, from the adoptive mothers and fathers, and from many of the birth mothers of the adopted children. The data include an initial study in the late 1970s, a ten-year follow-up of the children in the late 1980s, interviews with the parents in about half the adoptive families between 1997 and 2002, and a short mail questionnaire in 2002-2005 focused on life outcomes. The second sample consists of 220 families who adopted a child from the same institution prior to 1966. The data are comprised of item responses and scale scores from two personality inventories completed by mail in 1980 by 215 fathers, 219 mothers, 302 adopted children, and 63 biological children of the adoptive parents. The inventories were The California Psychological Inventory and the Thurstone Temperament Schedule.

For depositor requirements for access to restricted data, click on 'other information' tab at the bottom of this page.

publicationCitation.value: Horn, J. M., & Loehlin, J. C. (2010).  Heredity and Environment in 300 Families:  The Texas Adoption Project.  Piscataway, NJ: Transaction Publishers.
